message.content:
We first calculate the Free Cash Flow (FCF) by summing the net cash flows from operating and investing activities. In the provided cash flow statement, these are:

• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –7,724,112.71  
• Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities = –480,116.37  

So, FCF = –7,724,112.71 + (–480,116.37) = –8,204,229.08

Next, we calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio using the formula:
  Current Assets Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / End-of-period Total Current Assets

From the balance sheet and income statement, we have:
• End Total Current Assets = 6,951,011.84  
• Total Revenue = 5,755,241.17  

Thus, Current Assets Turnover Ratio = 5,755,241.17 / 6,951,011.84 ≈ 0.83

Presenting the final answer in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-8204229.08",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.83"
  }
}
